immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Securing immediate hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, ROVs, and submersibles in the US, prioritizing opportunities identified through direct engagement with relevant US-based groups and universities.

Key Interests: US-based organizations and universities involved in underwater volcano research, undersea habitat design, and ROV/submersible technology; attending US-based meetups and scuba events related to underwater robotics and habitats; identifying specific US universities with strong ocean engineering programs relevant to underwater volcanology and submersible technology; securing hands-on experience with ROVs and submersibles through internships, volunteer work, or university programs.  Emphasis on practical, hands-on training.

Immediate Priorities:  Researching and applying to US universities offering relevant programs; directly contacting US-based organizations conducting research in underwater volcanology and utilizing ROV/submersible technologies; attending relevant diving/scuba events and technical meetups in the US to network and learn;  actively seeking out groups focused on underwater habitat design.

Research Priorities:  ROV and submersible applications in deep-sea volcanic environments;  undersea habitat design, construction, and operation;  practical submersible and ROV operation and maintenance; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities and organizations offering hands-on opportunities in underwater robotics and volcanology.  Focus on finding practical training and experience related to both ROV/submersible technology and undersea habitat design.

Further Exploration:  Locating and contacting US-based diving, technical, and academic event organizers; actively pursuing hands-on ROV and submersible experience, particularly within the context of undersea habitat design and operation;  expanding research into specific US universities and their
